business.headline: Can you open two PPF accounts? Check detailsThe combined yearly deposit in both your PPF account and that of your child's account cannot go beyond Rs 1.5 lakh.

Trump started the tariff war. Now a weak dollar has him on the back footAs Trump's tariff strategy faces mounting challenges, a weakening dollar and rising inflation threaten to undermine his economic goals, forcing the US into a precarious position as global trade tensions escalate.

IMF backs India's stance on tariffs, presses US-China on fair tradeAmid rising global tensions, the IMF sees India's moves on tariffs as a rare bright spot, urging the world's largest economies to rebuild trust and strengthen a fair trade system.

Life insurance claim rejected? Here's how to get it correctGetting an insurance claim approved has become a nightmare nowadays. Nithin Kamath, in a post, also said that many avoid life insurance because policies as they are confusing and getting harder to understand.

Good Friday 2025: Are Sensex and Nifty closed for trading today?This week has been a short one for stock market participants. The markets opened only for three days, from April 15 to April 17. They were shut on Monday, April 14, in observance of Dr. Baba Saheb Ambedkar Jayanti.

Thumbay International Research Grant awards 14 projects at Gulf Medical UniversityThe 14 selected projects, led by top researchers from institutions like Harvard Medical School, University of Arizona, and Regensburg University, were chosen for their exceptional quality and originality.

Trump's tariffs could hurt US, but an opportunity for India: Ruchir SharmaRuchir Sharma believes India's emerging role in global trade could reshape its economic future, with a potential influx of investment as the US faces trade challenges and shifts in global capital flows.

Opting for new tax regime? Check out these 5 benefitsThe revisions introduced under the new tax regime aim to make the new regime easier, cut down on paperwork, and minimise the confusion many individuals experience in filing their returns.

Infosys Q4 results: Profit drops 12%, final dividend set at Rs 22The IT major clocked revenue of Rs 40,925 crore for the March quarter, up 8% from Rs 37,923 crore a year ago. In constant currency terms, revenue grew 4.8% YoY but declined 3.5% sequentially.

No public listing in 2 months: Where have IPOs disappeared?Just nine companies have listed on the mainboard till April this year, compared to 25 in the same period last year, and most didn't even leave a mark.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end nearly 2% higher as banking stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex ended 1508.91 higher at 78,553.20, while the NSE Nifty50 settled 414.45 points higher at 23,851.65.
Sunscreen faceoff: Honasa vs HUL in court over ad claimsThe core of the argument is SPF, the sun protection factor which measures how well a sunscreen protects against harmful UV rays.

entertainment.headline: Sinners review: Michael B Jordan's twin engine roars loud in this gripping vampire dramaReleased-Fri Apr 18, 2025Sinners movie review: Michael B Jordan delivers a captivating performance in Ryan Coogler's 'Sinners,' where he plays the Smokestack twins in a 1930s vampire drama. Coogler creates a suspenseful and dramatic narrative enriched with music and unexpected twists, says our review.

Ibrahim Ali Khan, Rasha Thadani enjoy IPL match together, Veer Pahariya joinsActors Ibrahim Ali Khan and Rasha Thadani were clicked together, enjoying the IPL match in Mumbai. They were also joined by Veer Pahariya.

Malayalam actor retracts complaint against Shine Tom Chacko, requests anonymityMalayalam actor Vincy Aloshious has decided to withdraw her complaint against fellow actor Shine Tom Chacko. She has also requested that her name not be disclosed to the public.

Liked Adolescence? Telugu film Court has important message, pertinent in IndiaIf you liked Netflix's 'Adolescence', which talked about teenage sexuality and alpha male syndrome, here's a Telugu film, Court: State vs A Nobody, that talks about the POCSO Act.

Namrata Shirodkar, children enjoy Nick Jonas's show, Priyanka sends loveMahesh Babu's wife and former actor Namrata Shirodkar enjoyed watching Nick Jonas' Broadway show, The Last Five Years. Priyanka Chopra reacted to their lovable message after the show.

Vicky Kaushal, Huma Qureshi, celebs in awe of Akshay's Kesari 2: Absolute magicA star-studded screening for Akshay Kumar's 'Kesari Chapter 2' was hosted by the makers on Thursday. Celebs including Vicky Kaushal, Huma Qureshi, Avneet Kaur and Nandish Sandhu, among others, praised the film, calling it 'absolute magic'.

Tamil actor, MIA after posting explicit content, found undergoing medical careTamil actor Sri alias Shriram Natarajan, who had gone missing for the past few days, is currently under medical care, a statement issued by director Lokesh Kanagaraj read. His family and friends were looking out for him after he posted explicit videos on Instagram.

Kajol rolls her eyes, looks visibly irked by paps at Kesari 2 screening. WatchKajol was visibly irked by the paparazzi, who were shouting while she was posing with Ananya Panday at 'Kesari 2' screening. She asked them to 'calm down'.

Jaat box office Day 8: Sunny Deol's 'dhai kilo ka haath' wins audience in 1st weekSunny Deol's 'Jaat' continues to move at a decent pace at the box office even amid a fresh controversy involving Christian community members claiming that a scene in the film hurt their religious sentiments. The film has finished its first week's run.

Jaat movie scene stirs row, case against Sunny Deol, Randeep HoodaA man in Jalandhar has filed a case against Sunny Deol, Randeep Hooda and Vineet Kumar Siingh, among others from the 'Jaat' team, for hurting religious sentiments.

Saif Ali Khan on playing diverse roles: Great to have done a Hum Tum, OmkaraActor Saif Ali Khan, in an exclusive conversation with India Today, shared interesting anecdotes about 'Omkara'. He expressed his happiness in getting to play diverse roles throughout his career.

Lorrie Morgan cancels shows to support husband battling mouth cancerLorrie Morgan cancels upcoming performances to care for her husband, Randy White, who is undergoing mouth cancer treatment. Morgan, grateful for support, focuses on family and privacy during this challenging time.

Love Island USA Spinoff: Full cast revealed for 'Beyond the Villa'Peacock's new spinoff Love Island: Beyond the Villa premieres this summer, reuniting fan-favorite Islanders as they navigate fame, relationships, and personal growth outside the villa.

MobLand Episode 4: When and where to stream 'Rat Trap' on Paramount+MobLand Episode 4, "Rat Trap," drops on April 20, 2025. It will stream at midnight PT and 3 a.m. ET. The episode continues the tense crime drama with high-stakes twists.

Dolly Parton to release new memoir 'Star of the Show' this NovemberDolly Parton, 79, announces her new book Star of the Show: My Life on Stage, chronicling her decades-long music career with personal stories, rare photos, and a narrated audiobook.

Meet Shalla-Bal: Julia Garner's Silver Surfer shines in 2025's fantastic fourJulia Garner stars as Shalla-Bal, a female Silver Surfer, in The Fantastic Four: First Steps. The 2025 reboot introduces Marvel's First Family to the MCU, with connections to future Avengers films.

general news.headline: Protect rights of own minorities: India raps Bangladesh over Bengal riots remarkIndia's strong remarks come a day after Bangladesh called on Indian authorities to protect minority Muslim communities affected by the violence in Bengal.

Inside Cambridge's elite brothel scandal that got Indian-origin CEO trappedBehind luxury condos and Harvard's shadow was an elite brothel for the ultrarich, complete with background checks for a USD 600-an-hour 'girlfriend experience'. An Indian-origin CEO is among its long list of patrons that includes doctors, lawyers and entrepreneurs of the Massachusetts-based sex-service network.

Police say the suspects were known to the victim and from another community. They are also trying to confirm whether the attackers are minors or adults.

New study flips the script: Marriage may raise dementia riskClaims that marriage has a positive effect on your mental health are up for challenge as the new study by researchers at Florida State University suggests that people who are unmarried, whether never married or divorced, may actually have a lower risk of developing dementia than their married counterparts.

Reddit user claims ChatGPT cured their 5-year jaw clicking problem in 60 secondsIn a Reddit post titled "After 5 years of jaw clicking (TMJ or temporomandibular joint), ChatGPT cured it in 60 seconds," the user detailed their experience with chronic jaw clicking on the left side, which they attributed to a past boxing injury.

JNU professor sacked over charges of sexually harassing Japanese embassy officialThe alleged incident took place a few months ago during a university event, according to JNU sources. University officials confirmed that this was not an isolated case and several complaints against the professor had been received in the past.

Karnataka High Court raps state over Waqf Act protest amid top court hearingThe Karnataka High Court criticised the state government for permitting a protest against the Waqf (Amendment) Act in Mangaluru. The court called the move inappropriate and procedurally flawed as the issue is still pending before the Supreme Court

Ex-Harvard morgue manager stole brains, heads, bones and sold them with wife's helpA former Harvard morgue manager, Cedric Lodge, has agreed to plead guilty to stealing and selling body parts from donated cadavers.

Brad Haddin says Punjab Kings now believe they can win in any situationPunjab Kings (PBKS) assistant coach Brad Haddin said the players now believe they can win in any situation. "I think it reinsures everything that we're doing; the playing group starts to trust. And wins like that, as you've seen the other night, the way we got ourselves back into the game was special. The players have started to believe that they can win from any situation," Haddin told the reporters ahead of the Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) clash.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
